body_content.explanation: the point, area, or line that is formed by the meeting of two lines, surfaces, roads, etc.:
examples: You go around corners too fast when you're driving!
There's a postbox on the corner (= the place where the street crosses another).
Click the icon in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen.
I have a bruise where I hit my leg on the corner of the table.
They live just around/round the corner (= very close although not in the same road) - so we see them all the time.

body_content.explanation: a part of a larger area, often somewhere quiet or far away:
examples: They live in a remote corner of Scotland, miles from the nearest store.

body_content.explanation: a kick in football or a shot in hockey that is taken from the corner of the playing area
If a vehicle corners well, badly, etc., it drives around corners in the stated way:
examples: It's a powerful car, but it doesn't corner well.

body_content.explanation: to force a person or an animal into a place or situation from which they cannot easily escape:
examples: Once the police had cornered her in the basement, she gave herself up.
